bibdata.title: Remove the duplicate substring from the location code

comments.body:
@kevinreiss @mzelesky can you review https://bibdata-alma-staging.princeton.edu/locations/holding_locations ? It has the updated external_name from https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1178.
 Do we still need to remove the substring when it is a duplicate of the Library name? 
For example do we want to change the display in the catalog to be: 
`Engineering Library - Engineering Library - Serials` 
vs 
`Engineering Library - Engineering Library - Engineering Library: Serials` ? 
Or would it be better to be: `Engineering Library - Serials`

I think the last option is best for display purposes. @mzelesky I know why we keep the Library name in the location with Alma's configuration, but stripping it out for display purposes in Blacklight makes for less repetitive, cluttered UI.

comments.body: https://github.com/pulibrary/figgy/pull/4462 will close this issue.
Blocked by current work on availability.

@mzelesky is it sufficient to ensure that the holdings data comes through? Do we need to accept a flag turning it off? It seems like consumer can just ignore those fields.

@tpendragon if that's the plan, should we delete https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/26a21f36629906417a7a195fe6503bd426d8360d/app/controllers/bibliographic_controller.rb#L25-L28 and the opts argument at https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/8d505697ae90aa91b06a0662830f73e846535933/app/adapters/alma_adapter/bib.rb#L11
Reopening and moving to inbox for clarification since we're not actually using the param.
@christinach do you mean it shouldn't index? Only index 020$a?

orangelight.title: Display AVA/AVE fields in staff view.

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/38570893/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/38570893)

Coverage remained the same at 96.613% when pulling **c5afa0d666c7b0138392aab9d1bfcdcc49937153 on 712-ava-field** into **0c7cd861b561ce1a2bcffe2487b8fb66da5429d0 on main**.

orangelight.title: Electronic records need "online" badge and link in search results
Display electronic record "Online" badge in search results

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/38574704/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/38574704)

Coverage increased (+0.009%) to 96.622% when pulling **43defbbf411c535be385c90a8e51ab672fc14c9a on 2388-online-badge** into **0c7cd861b561ce1a2bcffe2487b8fb66da5429d0 on main**.

Why does it require https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/pull/268? something similar was happening here and I'd love to understand. https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/pull/2370/files#diff-f3be7114593cea59759b4f73c1fe286d347833930e56edf12b4561ff96797befL19

@hackartisan It requires https://github.com/pulibrary/pul_solr/pull/268 because without `electronic_portfolio_s` in the `fl` it doesn't come back in the solr response for search results, so we can't parse it.
oh, @tpendragon, one last problem is that the test is failing in CI.
@hackartisan It'll fail CI until the pul_solr PR is merged.
oh, yeah. 👍🏻 it's merged

orangelight.title: Migrate or remove ETAS logic in availability javascript
Update alma base to point at the alma catalog
Copies in the library section should not display in the record page for online resources

comments.body: @christinach has indicated that we should continue indexing ELF holdings if they show up, so the implementation here is to add an exception to this view so that if it's an ELF holding don't display it in the physical holdings.

Summarizing content in #alma-development:

We should close https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1203# first, there's a chance this will result in ELF locations not being indexed into the holdings field and thus closing this ticket without adding view logic.

> @christinach has indicated that we should continue indexing ELF holdings if they show up, so the implementation here is to add an exception to this view so that if it's an ELF holding don't display it in the physical holdings.

@tpendragon  we don't want to index elf holdings. I said that we want to index the records but not the elfs. The electronic records (elf invalid locations) will be addressed with https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/issues/1202.
I updated the google document for the meeting on 04-07-2021 with an updated XD link for all the wireframes and two more links for two additional versions of the Record page.

requests.title: Verify that current issues come through as items

comments.body:
The documentation says they are migrated as items:

Voyager customers can use the serials module to record receipt of both standing orders and serials. The check-in records in the serials module are considered issues for migration purposes and are migrated as Alma items.

https://knowledge.exlibrisgroup.com/Alma/Implementation_and_Migration/Migration_Guides_and_Tutorials/Voyager_to_Alma_Migration_Guide#Predic[…]tterns
